turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That's straight through the central core... up toward the top of the city... Once you've got her, avoid the main transports, they'll shut down immediately.  Your only chance is through the service shafts. There are no sensors there... All right now, get going, you don't have time.  I hope you can remember everything.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We'll be back before you are, old man.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: May the Force be with you.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Good morning!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What do you mean, 'good morning'? Do you mean that it is a good morning for you, or do you wish me a good morning, although it is obvious I'm not having one, or do you find that mornings in general are good?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: All of them altogether. You seem to have gotten yourself into a fine mess!  What happened?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Sorry, but that was the only way to get you down.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Couldn't we have tried to think of something else first!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You're lucky those Tuskens didn't boil you before they hung you out to dry.  They're not the friendly sort. You'd best be moving on before they come back.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm Luke Starkiller, guardian of the Bendu.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Oh, so you're a warrior then?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Of course.  I'm a Bendu officer.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Who are you anyway?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You might say I'm part of the landscape here.  They call me Ben Kenobi.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're General Kenobi?!?  The Jedi knight!  The commander of the White Legions?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm afraid it's been a long time since the White Legions roamed the stars.  But I have the memories.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I don't see why.  I don't believe we've ever met.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I am the son of Annikin Starkiller.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know who you are.  Stand up so that we can talk properly.  You're embarrassing me.  I'm not that important.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you are... I know your 'Diary of the Clone Wars' by heart.  My father...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I... I'm not a Bendu Officer.  I'm not even a startrooper.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You saw through me?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You could put it that way.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I assure you my intentions weren't bad.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I know your intentions.  I probably know much more about you than you realize.  In many ways you're a lot like your father.  He was an indulgent man, but a clever warrior.  Now what brings you out here?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: My father told me many stories about you.  He said if I was ever in trouble, to come here... I need your help.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm afraid I've gotten too old for this sort of thing.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you must!  I can't do it alone. I'm not at all like my father.  I'd never make it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I already know you think you're worthless.  I recommend you learn to think of yourself in a better light, for what you believe you are is what you become.  I haven't been involved in anything like this for many years.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But the Sith Lords are involved! Whatever information this R-2 unit is carrying, it must be awfully important.  They're probably looking for him... I'm no match for the Sith. This is a Jedi's work.  This is your responsibility!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Not any more!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You were right.  It is my responsibility.  The Force of Others brought the message to you and then it brought you to me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: My father used to talk about the Force of Others.  But he never told me what it was...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Let's just say the Force is something a Jedi Warrior deals with.  It is an energy field in oneself, a power that controls ones acts, yet obeys ones commands.  It is nothing, yet it makes marvels appear before your very eyes. All living things generate this Force field, even you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You mean I generate an energy field?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It surrounds you and radiates from you.  A Jedi can feel it flowing from him...  ... from here!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Could I learn to feel it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: That is not a human decision, not your or mine.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: It means you'd better get some rest. We'll be leaving for Mos Eisley first thing in the morning.  The trip will be difficult and dangerous, but it's the only spaceport with ships large enough to get us to Organa Major.  Now go on!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Luke, I'm coming along to do what I can, but I'm tired and I'm depending on you to get us through.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you're still a powerful Jedi. You don't need my help.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: A Jedi's power is measured by the amount of the Force that is stored within him, and I have little of the Force left in me.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: How can you store an energy field within you?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: When a creature dies, the force it generated remains.  The Force is all around us.  It can be collected and transmitted through the use of a Kiber crystal.  It's the only way to amplify the power of the Force within you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Don't you have a Kiber crystal?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I had one, but it was taken at the battle of Condawn...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: That's where my father was killed.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes.  It was a black day.  One of my disciple's took the crystal and became a Sith Lord.  It was a black day.  The few crystals that remain are in the possession of the Sith Lords on Alderaan.  That's how they've become so powerful.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Do the Sith know the ways of the Force?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: They use the Bogan Force.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Like Bogan weather, or bogan times. I thought that was just a saying.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: There are two halves of the Force of Others.  One is positive and will help you if you learn how to use it.  But the others half will kill you if you aren't careful.  This negative side of the Force is called the Bogan, which is where the expression came from, and it is the part that is used by the Dark Lords to destroy their opponents.  Both halves are always present.  The Force is on your right, the Bogan is on your left.  The Kiber Crystal can amplify either one.  The Crystal Darth stole was the last one in the possession of the Jedi.  When he joined the Sith, the power of the Dark Lords was completed.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We don't have that kind of money. How much do you think I can get for the speeder?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Five, maybe.  Let me handle it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: This is the last place.  Shouldn't we just take what we can get and think of something else?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He's bluffing...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: When we get Artoo's message to them, you think they'll try to rescue the princess?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I doubt it.  It would be foolish for the rebel forces to come out of hiding. I know your feelings.  You'd best forget them.  It's for your own good. There will be no saving her from the prisons of Alderaan.  It's the heart of the Sith.  The Bogan Force is the most heavy there.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But she's a member of The Twelve Families.  How can they hold her?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: These are doubtful times.  The Empire has grown bold in its disregard of the...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What's wrong?  What's happening?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Keep away, I'm fine, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yes... the Force... something horrible has happened.  I couldn't see what it was, or where it was, but it was terrible... terrible beyond description... the cry of millions dying at once.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Are you sure you don't need it?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I rarely use it any more.  I have the Force.  The Force is more powerful than any pistol.  You shouldn't put too much faith in that weapon.  Work on becoming aware of the Force... learn to feel its presence within you.  Try to sense what it's telling you.  It's the only thing you can rely on.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What do I do?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: All you have to do is lose your thinking self.  Don't focus on anything.  Let your body do your thinking... You have to learn to act on what you feel, not what you think ... If I had the crystal, it would be much easier.  You could feel the Force immediately... but for now, let yourself go.  You'll pick it up... and someday you'll have no need for that pistol either.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: He can't find Organa Major.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But she is the only link between us and the hidden bases.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You mean we should go after her!...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I didn't say that, but it appears to be a logical alternative.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't see!  How can I fight?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Try to feel it.  Use the Force...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't do it.  I'll get hit.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Stop thinking, and start feeling. Let yourself go.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: See, once you let yourself go you can do it.  You'll get it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I don't get it, but I guess I did block it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What about the princess?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You go after the princess. I am an old man and would be of little help.  I must try to find the Crystal.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm not going alone!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: The Kiber Crystal.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Keep it with you always.  You'll have more need of it than I.  It will bring the Force to you.  You've already learned to feel it... Now you must learn to use it.

turns.speaker: BIGGS
turns.text: Of course, where you been kid?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You look great!  The uniform and everything!

turns.speaker: BIGGS
turns.text: That's no battle, kid... They're just sitting there!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But there was a lot of firing earlier...

turns.speaker: BIGGS
turns.text: I'll tell you, Luke, and this is between you and me.  The star force isn't all it's cracked up to be. Frankly, it's a bore, and it's going to stay that way as long as this system is neutral...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you always said things were so great at the academy... What happened?

turns.speaker: BIGGS
turns.text: The academy is fantastic... Of course, they won't teach you anything about flying you don't already know.  Most of the instructors are very conservative pilots.  You can fly circles around them... but there is a lot on the scientific side that is down-right amazing, and you get a lot of discipline... but after you graduate, don't join the star force -- go free-lance.  It's the only way to get into the action... I can't wait until my hitch is up.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: At least you're doing something... I'd give anything to be in your position.

turns.speaker: BIGGS
turns.text: Just be warned, that things aren't always as they seem... especially the starforce recruiting posters.

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: You're Starkiller?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: Have you been checked out?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I was considered one of the best bush pilots on Sullust. I've also had six hours on the T-2.

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: Six hours, huh?  Well, that's your ship there.  You're blue five.  You stay glued to me.  I don't want any independent operations out there. Personally I think it's foolish for them to be sending fresh kids out on a job like this.  This is no joy ride we're going on.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: Blue Five, does that glare bother you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I've got it blocked.  I'm all right.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm right behind you, Blue Leader.

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: Blue Five, break off your cover attack.  It's too late.  Make your own run on the exhaust port.  Do you copy, Luke?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yes, sir, but I can get him...

turns.speaker: BLUE LEADER
turns.text: Forget it, son.

turns.speaker: CONTROLLER
turns.text: No reply on any circuits... It's drifting on a point twenty-seven skew.  It's not close enough to identify.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: Alert squad five, but hold them until we know what it is.

turns.speaker: CONTROLLER
turns.text: Should we alert the Sith Lords?

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: I'll make a report later.

turns.speaker: CONTROLLER
turns.text: As close as we can make out, it appears to be a Corellian gypsy vessel... It's not under power.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: Send one squad up.

turns.speaker: COMMANDER
turns.text: We don't get many visitors.  Let's take a look at it.

turns.speaker: CONTROLLER
turns.text: Send out a boarding party.  Full assault gear.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Put that thing away or you're going to get us all killed.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Yes, your highness. I'll let you open it then.  It won't be too long before they figure out what happened to us.  This has turned into a brilliant escape!

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: It could be worse...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Here come six more... grid two!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Was this trip really necessary?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: There are only three or four left.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Chewbacca, it's time we showed them this isn't the regulation F8-88 Cargo Trawler.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: All the data banks in Artoo are still secure.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Then I think we're due the reward you offered... and it had better be substantial after what we've been through.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: When Artoo has been safely delivered to my forces, you get your reward. You have my guarantee.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What's that little 'droid' carrying that's so blasted important?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: The plans and specifications to a battle station with enough fire power to destroy an entire system... Our only hope in destroying it is to find its weakness, which we will determine from the data I stored in Artoo.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: We captured the plans in a raid on the Imperial shipyards, but we fell under attack before I could get the data to safety, so I hid it in this Artoo unit and sent him off.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Where are you taking us now anyway?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: The fourth moon of Yavin.  I've given the coordinates to Chewbacca.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'd better go see how he's doing.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I don't see how we're going to find anything out here.  This terrain is hopeless.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Did it occur to you they might find us?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: We must hurry to the base.  We have little time before the Death Star arrives.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'd like to get paid before that eventually.  I don't plan to stick around for the fireworks.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What about us?  Are we to wait forever?  Is our reward to be blown to bits on this forsaken system, while your fleet mounts some suicidal attack on that Death Star? Part of my reward is that I be around to spend it.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I have little time for your mercenary concerns, but I am grateful for the service you have given to our cause.  What is your price?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Organa Major is a rebel system. There will be quite a few starfleet patrols between here and there... It could be a little tricky if you want to avoid them... ten thousand.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: That's pretty steep.  We'd like to talk it over first.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You got yourself a ship.  We can leave as soon as you're ready.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We have a little business to take care of first, but it shouldn't take long. We'll be back shortly.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Who's the pilot?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: It's automatic.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'd keep that thing close just in case, if I were you... I've been around from one end of the galaxy to the other and believe me this Force of Others stuff may make for good religion, but there is no substitute for a good weapon at your side.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You don't believe in the Force?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sorcery!  I believe in myself... I determine my destiny, not some mystical energy field.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I found it... It's just not there.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You can't!  We've come this far.  We must find them...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Maybe you should just drop us off. I'm sure we can find someone willing to take the risk.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: All right, all right! You've got a ship!  But where do we go from here?  They probably took her to find the hidden bases... I don't see how we can find the rebels before she breaks.  The Empire has already beat us out.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: No, it's impossible... No one, and I mean no one would venture anywhere near the Alderaan system... I'm a free booter, not revolutionary.  You're aboard the wrong ship, son!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Maybe the fact that no one would go there voluntarily could help us. They probably don't think anyone would dare try.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Don't you believe it.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, I practice a lot...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You're good with 'remotes,' but how are you against something living?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I don't know... I've never fought anyone.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Between his howling and your blasting everything in sight, the entire city is going to know we're here.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Good!  I prefer a straight fight to all this sneaking around.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: This isn't going to work.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Why didn't you say so before.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I think I did.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Something has happened to them. Let's try this way...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Let's try this way!  Holy Maker.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: See Threepio, come in, See Threepio. I wonder where they are??  See Threepio...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I think she's going to be all right.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not if this tunnel deadends.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Is he afraid of the water?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: No, he smells something... but we haven't time to worry about it now.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Watch it!  Move back.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Get Chewbacca.  Try to get around it. I'll draw it away.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: It's only light that doesn't affect it.  Solid things, like rocks, can hurt it!  Fire above him!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Move out of the way!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Get to the ship!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Come back here... Where are you going?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I don't pick up any life form concentration down there.  She'd better be right.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: They must be shielded somehow.  I'm sure the base is there.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, if it's not, we'll be facing that Death Star all by our lonesome.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're a good pilot... I've learned a lot from you... I wish you...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I know, but the chances for survival here just aren't great enough in my book.  I've got what I came for. Now I've got to get back to my ship.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I noticed you were having some problems, Blue Five... I thought I'd help.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Thanks, old buddy.  I'll be with you in a second.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: A Wookiee broke loose up here, but we've subdued him... There is a lot of damage, and three, no four, casualties...

turns.speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: We'll send a squad up.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: No need, everything's under control.

turns.speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: With four casualties?!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: The... ah door's jammed.  Give us a few minutes to get it fixed.

turns.speaker: INTERCOM VOICE
turns.text: Who is this?  What's your operating...

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Enough!  I already know about the data you've intercepted, but its' too late.  Whatever information you've gathered will be destroyed... You will come to know such suffering as only the Master of the Bogan Force can provide...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: You'll get no information from me. You have no authority... the council can't hold me!

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: It appears your ship had an accident. I will see to it that your death is duely reported.  There will be no one to save you this time.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: The 'Death Star' has become operational.  There is no force in the universe that can stop us now.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: They'll find its weakness.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: It's too late... We already tested it on Organa Major.  It appears your data never got through.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: It would be much easier if you were to tell us where the outposts are... Otherwise we'll be forced to destroy every suspicious system... What a waste...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: What is it?  What's going on?  Where are we?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're safe.  We've come to get you out of here... Just relax.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I am Luke Starkiller at your service.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: There'll be time for that later. Now let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Are there medical facilities on Yavin?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: He'll be well cared for.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: And you?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I... I don't know.  I guess I never thought about it... I just want to help.  I want to be in on the attack. I want my own ship.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: If you're as good a pilot as you are a swordsman... We're the ones who have been rewarded.

turns.speaker: OWEN
turns.text: First thing tomorrow morning you're going to check those condensing units on the south ridge.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I will, but I'll have enough time to transmit my application first.

turns.speaker: OWEN
turns.text: You'll check the condensing unit first... and you're not going to bed until those 'droids' are completely cleaned up...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you promised!  I've saved enough money and now you have the extra help ... you promised!

turns.speaker: OWEN
turns.text: I said we'd see.  And as it is, I was forced to borrow your academy savings to buy the new 'droids.'  When you've saved it up again, I'll let you go.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You used my savings!  You stole my savings.  If my father were here...

turns.speaker: OWEN
turns.text: Your father's dead.  Don't ever forget who's taking care of you, giving you food, giving you shelter, and giving you the allowance in the first place. If you plan to work at the academy the way you work around here, you won't last very long.  I don't want another word.  Finish your dinner, then finish cleaning those 'droids.'

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Not unless you could get me into the military academy at Anchorhead.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir, I'm only a 'droid,' and not very knowledgeable of such things... not on this system anyway. As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which system we're on.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: That's all right.  There is nothing anyone can do about it.  You can call me Luke.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  I'm See Threepio, Human Cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo Detoo.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: There's a lot of carbon scoring here. It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Indeed, sir, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good shape as we are, what with the rebellion and all...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You've been in the Counter Wars?... Against the Empire?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Tell me where you've been.  I am going to become a startrooper and fight in the wars.  My father was a Jedi!  Were you in many battles?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Several, I think.  There is not much to tell.  I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories, not at making them interesting anyway...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: According to my father's tapes, this is the spot where General Kenobi lives, but the instruments just don't match up with the landscape... There is no doubt about it, we're lost...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I don't see how anyone could live in this forsaken place.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, I don't know what to do now. We'll just have to head inland and see if we can't find a settlement.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: What happened?  I'm sorry, sir, I must have taken a bad step...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Can you stand?  We've got to get out of here before those Tuskens come back.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I can't make it.  You go on, master Luke.  It doesn't make sense for you to risk yourself on my account.  I'm done for.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: No, you're not.  What kind of talk is that...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I think we're going to need them. Blast it!

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Sir, I have a couple of extra circuits.  Perhaps they might bring something.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Well, ask him.  Tell him we need five thousand.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Let him have it.  You're winning anyway.  It doesn't make any difference.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I know, sir, but it's the principle of the thing.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Level five, Detention block A-23, cell 2187.  She's still alive...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Send feed-back into the control sensors in that Detention block.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: See Threepio... do you copy?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I read you sir.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You're back.  What happened?  Never mind.  What's going on?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I'm afraid we're not plugged in at the moment, sir.  We've had some problems.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Are you safe?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: For the moment.  We're in the main hangar.  Artoo is trying to plug into the system now.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Good.  We're right above you.  Stand by.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Wait a minute, slow down!... That's better.  They're where?  They what? They are?  Oh, no! We're going to be mashed into conduit before this is over...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: See Threepio!  Do you copy?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Holy Maker, Threepio.  I forgot...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Are you there, sir?  We're going...

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Threepio!  Shut down all garbage mashers on your level... Do you copy?? Threepio, shut down all garbage...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Thank you, sir.  Your kindness is greatly appreciated, but if it's at all possible, Artoo and I would like to remain in your service.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'd consider it an honor.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You got some guts for a rich kid. I guess you and me could be buddies.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What an honor...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Hey, don't laugh. Everyone oughta have a friend like me !

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: What makes you think... you'll make... squad leader, Rico ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Something... I've got...you don't.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You rich kids... are all the same !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: It isn't about rich... It's about who's best...!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Wanting it doesn't make you the best one for the job.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Oh, yeah ? I don't see anyone else here with the chops to lead.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Well, maybe you better look again.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Our love will grow, dear, year by year...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Bye ! Write me ! I'm gonna kill you guys !

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Funny how they always want to be your friends after they kick your guts out.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: It's what I deserve.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Whad'ya talkin  about ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I joined up for her. I wouldn't even be here if it wasn't for her. I'm a fool.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You made squad leader on your own, and, hey, you still got me to kick around.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I say we all go to the laser parlor and get cut together.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What do I want with a scar ?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No, this hurts.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: YAAAAAAAA !

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Mobile Infantery rules !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Death to all bugs !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Lieutenant's bought the farm. Where's the Sarge...?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: I didn't see him !

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Dizzy says you two knew this Rasczak character in Buenos Aires...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He was our teacher... He was great.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yeah, well, I hear he's a real nutbuster.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: No way. Big K taught me I ain't executive material.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What about it, Diz ?

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Jeez, we musta killed a million already...!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Not enough, I guess.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: We got reinforced. Most of'em just got outa boot...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: We're the old men, Ace.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: We'll take this high ground. Lookouts there and therte and up there. If the bugs come upstairs in this neighbor-hood, we'll be the first to know.

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Got it. Fleet tactical wants to know where they can deploy the skimmers.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Down there on the flats, eh ? Listen up, Roughnecks ! Our primary objective is to assist our friends from the Fleet...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Mr. Barcalow, save power, don't waste it on workers... Ace, tell Aardvark we're on our way...

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: Yes, sir !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Saddle up, Roughnecks !

turns.speaker: ACE
turns.text: You heard the Lieutenant ! On the bounce, troopers !

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Rico, did you give the recruit permission to remove his helmet ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Sir, yes, sir. Breckinridge reported a helmet malfunction, and I asked him to show it to me, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Are you rated to repair a Marauder power suit, Rico ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Sir, no, sir.

turns.speaker: C.O.
turns.text: Then why did you order your man to remove his helmet during a live fire exercise ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Sir, I needed everyone in my squad operational, sir... I... I wanted to win, sir.
